articles.author: Vuk Zdinjak
articles.summary: The real issue with artificial intelligence-generated content on the internet is not AI, but users. Only a person skilled at a job, capable of doing it without AI assistance, can harness the power of AI correctly. Laziness and greed are also reasons behind bad AI use.

articles.title: GOP squares off over AI ban
articles.author: Sylvan Lane
articles.summary: There is a push to ban state regulation of artificial intelligence for 10 years in President Trump's tax and spending bill. Republicans from both chambers are coming out against the provision, which calls for a 10-year moratorium on state laws regulating AI models and systems. Even some House Republicans who already voted to pass the bill in the lower chamber are speaking out against it.

articles.summary: About 100 people marched down Main Street in Downtown Memphis on June 17, 2025 in protest of Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company, xAI, in front of a group led by a group called "Xinxia" to protest Elon Musk and xAI.

OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and his brother, Jack, are critical of Meta's recruitment efforts. Amazon is making a big push around AI agents that can perform tasks like writing code, summarizing information and automating tasks. Jassy thinks the size of Amazon's workforce will shrink over the next few years as the company benefits from its AI deployments.

articles.title: G7 members agree to increase public sector use of AI, collaborate on quantum
articles.author: Anja Karadeglija

They also want to promote investment in emerging quantum technologies. Canada will use its G7 presidency to host a series of "rapid solution labs" looking at barriers to AI adoption in public sector. It is the first time quantum technology has been a priority at a G7 meeting.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is already shaping society in ways that are invisible, unregulated and deeply personal. The new robotics engineering bachelor's degree program is the first and only robotics degree program in Minnesota. The artificial intelligence master's degree is the only graduate program of its kind in the Minnesota State system. The dean of MSU's College of Science, Engineering and Technology said it's important for the university to keep pace with industry demands.

articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: Can artificial delegates, autonomous agents that make decisions on our behalf, help us? They are a form of autonomous decision-making. They are controlled by an artificial intelligence. They can be programmed to make decisions for us on our request. It's called a "delegate".

articles.title: AI Is Getting More Human-like Everyday

articles.summary: A study by the Chinese Academy of Sciences and South China University of Technology suggests that AI chatbots are starting to mimic more human-like behavior. The study looked at advanced AI models like ChatGPT and Gemini Pro and found that the bots follow thought patterns similar to what's observed in human brains.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Impact On Our Brains According to an MIT Study
articles.author: Andrew R. Chow
articles.summary: A new study from MIT's Media Lab found that ChatGPT users had the lowest brain engagement and 'consistently underperformed at neural, linguistic, and behavioral levels' over the course of several months. Nataliya Kosmyna, the paper's main author, is concerned that as society increasingly relies on AI for convenience, brain development may be sacrificed.

articles.title: Elon Musk's AI Data Center Faces Lawsuit Over Air Pollution Complaints
articles.author: Jeff Young
articles.summary: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence data center in Memphis, Tennessee, faces a lawsuit over air pollution from the fleet of mobile gas-fired turbines the company uses to power the massive computer facility, called Colossus. Southern Environmental Law Center (SELC) told Musk's company, xAI, that it will sue on behalf of the NAACP. xAI installed dozens of natural gas turbines rather than wait for a connection to the local electric grid. SELC said the turbines emit smog-forming nitrogen oxide pollution and hazardous chemicals such as formaldehyde, pollutants tied to health problems.

articles.author: Andrew Kessel
articles.summary: Andy Jassy, CEO of Amazon, said in a memo to employees Tuesday that the company expects to reduce its corporate workforce over the next few years due to the growth of artificial intelligence. Amazon had nearly 1.6 million full- and part-time employees as of March 31, according to its latest quarterly results.

articles.title: Apple's AI Paper: Self-Serving or Substantive?
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Apple's research paper claims that AI systems' ability to reason effectively diminishes as problems become more complex. Industry experts question the value of investment in AI technology. Industry expert Michael Bennett stresses the importance of recognizing the limitations of current AI models early on. Businesses must carefully evaluate AI's practical applications and ROI.

articles.title: How courts can use AI to improve and speed access to justice
articles.author: caitlinhiggins
articles.summary: Thomson Reuters Institute and the National Center for State Courts report on the challenges facing the courts in the United States. They are looking for ways to streamline processes, increase efficiency, and save time using artificial intelligence (AI) technology. AI technology will never replace essential staff members like attorneys, court clerks, and paralegals, but it can streamline routine tasks and improve efficiency.

articles.title: Latin American countries to launch own AI model in September
articles.author: Fabian Cambero
articles.summary: A dozen Latin American countries are collaborating to launch Latam-GPT in September. It is the first large artificial intelligence language model trained to understand the region's diverse cultures and linguistic nuances. The model is based on Llama 3 AI technology and is trained using a regional network of computers.

articles.title: New York takes first steps to regulate large AI developers
articles.author: Raga Justin
articles.summary: Last week, New York passed the New York Responsible AI Safety and Education Act. It would require large developers of advanced AI models to establish robust safety and security plans. It also defines the worst-case scenarios that could result from unchecked deployment of frontier models. The legislation must be approved by Gov. Kathy Hochul. Tech companies and trade groups are lobbying against it.

articles.title: The drone racing world just had its John Henry moment. Battlefields will never be the same.

In the fourth type of race, an autonomous quadcopter drone built and trained by a team of scientists and students at Delft University of Technology's aerospace engineering MAVLab in the Netherlands beat three former DCL world champions, reaching speeds of nearly 60 mph.

articles.title: Here's How You Can Boost Your Productivity at Home With This AI Tool

articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI productivity tool developed by OpenAI. ChatGPT was released in 2022, but it has undergone major updates, notably to the free version.

articles.title: State-level AI ban in Trump's mega bill among points of tension between Democrats, Republicans

articles.summary: $500 million would be allocated to modernize government systems with AI and automation, but state-level regulations of AI would be blocked in dozens of states. At least 45 states introduced legislation regarding AI in 2024 and more than a dozen new regulatory proposals have been introduced in statehouses already in 2025. Tech industry leaders and companies are afraid that regulation of AI could limit its potential and make the United States less competitive.

articles.title: Google's Gemini panicked when playing Pokémon

articles.summary: Gemini 2.5 Pro is an AI model developed by Google and Anthropic. It can panic when its Pokémon are close to death. It takes hundreds of hours for Gemini to reason through a game that a child could complete in less time. With human assistance, the AI created agentic tools to solve the game's boulder puzzles.

articles.summary: AI Mode data is now counted towards totals in Google Search Console. The integration became fully active in the United States late last week. AI Mode organizes user queries into subtopics, searching for each one simultaneously to offer deeper exploration capabilities. It offers a more complete picture of search performance.

articles.title: Defense Department Awards OpenAI With $200 Million Contract * 100PercentFedUp.com * by Danielle

articles.title: N.Y. lawmakers advance sweeping AI protections
articles.summary: New York state lawmakers advanced legislation to regulate the use of artificial intelligence in the final days of the session, but it's unlikely to pass the state Assembly before time runs out. The bill would mandate developers perform impact assessments and manage the risk of its emerging AI tools. It would also protect whistleblowers so employees can speak out against reckless practices. Big tech companies have fought back against the proposals, arguing the liability standards would restrict development and create burdensome requirements.

articles.title: Lost in the middle: How LLM architecture and training data shape AI's position bias
articles.author: Adam Zewe
articles.summary: MIT researchers developed a theoretical framework to study how information flows through the machine-learning architecture that forms the backbone of language models. They found that certain design choices which control how the model processes input data can cause position bias. The research will be presented at the International Conference on Machine Learning.

I., organizations must 'reset their A.i. transformation approaches from scattered initiatives to strategic programs.

articles.title: Why Reddit Stock Is Jumping Today

The Community Intelligence platform's Reddit Insights service provides marketers with real-time information about trends and discussions that are occurring on the social media platform. The Conversation Summary add-on allows marketers to showcase relevant positive comments below their advertisements. Reddit is trading at 41 times this year's expected earnings.

articles.title: Opinion: The future belongs to those who can lead

articles.summary: The rise of artificial intelligence is transforming the workforce at a pace few imagined possible. The future won't be won by those who simply understand technology, but by people who can lead others through it. The fastest-growing roles across industries are those that require uniquely human attributes like creativity, problem-solving, resilience and emotional intelligence. Today's education system is too focused on test scores and metrics, while the deeper lessons of collaboration, responsibility and service are pushed to the margins.

articles.title: There's a '10% to 20% chance' that AI will displace humans completely, says 'godfather' of the technology

articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton is a computer scientist who won the 2018 Turing Award for his work on AI and deep learning. He is concerned about the risks of misusing AI and AI-augmented scams. He advises people to diversify their money and back up their data.
